website_summaries.verdict: Consider this budget alternative if you want something more visible out on the road for smaller vehicles.
pros: Can be used on tires up to 26"
Bright yellow plastic resin is both durable and extremely visible for emergency on-the-road repairs
Small and stackable to keep in a small car
Comes with a handy rope for pulling

customer_reviews.title: Only for 'simple' light level applications.
customer_reviews.text: These are only good enough to hold at a level grade. I had my 5th Wheel trailer roll up and onto my chock when on about a 3 degree grade. The chock was crushed. Fortunately, my truck held the trailer from going farther. I'm now ordering heavy duty rubber chocks.
customer_reviews.author: BigBox

customer_reviews.title: Roll Tide Chocks! SMH
customer_reviews.text: The product was very light-weight and made of what I consider to be cheap plastic but I gave it a shot. Luckily for me I was parked of a fairly flat surface but when I raised my car using a hand Jack, one of the chocks bent and nearly collapsed (I will have a picture shortly). The car did not roll forward but I am not sure that would not be true if I were on any type of decline. I'm going to request a refund and I will update this review to include the customer service response.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Gray

customer_reviews.title: Do not hold very good
customer_reviews.text: Chocked both wheels before unhooking. As soon as the ball was released from hitch the trailer rolled and chocks just slid. Now I have damage done to the back of my trailer and shop. Thankfully A: no one was behind the trailer. B: I have insurance. Pretty sure my rate will go up, but in the meantime I will use the x chocks. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money on better chocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and probably OK for lightweight camper
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend for a heavier camper. I have a 36' pull behind camper trailer. I purchased these and immediately noticed that the plastic chock easily slides unless fit sung beneath the camper tires. Then I accidentally rollered the camper over one of these chocks and my camper smashed it. My bad! I replaced these chocks with the black heavy duty rubber chocks. They're a bit more expensive but worth it. They grip well and I feel if I accidentally rolled the camper over the rubber chock it would survive. Conversely, the Camco product would probably be an Ok solution for a lightweight camper, but don;t use on a heavier camper.
customer_reviews.author: rfw1953

customer_reviews.title: My local Tractor Supply had them cheaper
customer_reviews.text: I am a new RVer. I purchased these without the rope mainly because of the cheaper price (11.00). They work exactly as they should except that the rope would definitely have made them easier to pull out. Now that I know that, I can't imagine why you would want them without a rope. Anyway, the only reason I gave them only 3 stars is because I saw the exact same ones, same brand, WITH the rope at Tractor Supply for under $4.00 each. Camco is selling the ones with the rope on Amazon as a 2-pack for $14.11. I would much rather have had the ones with the rope. :(
customer_reviews.author: Katherine J. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: An Expiration Date For A 'Super Wheel Chock' .
customer_reviews.text: Yup, this Super Wheel Chock expires 05/2019- -So how do you read the correct date? -Picture the face of a clock; the numbers 1 through 12 going around -Then look for an arrow pointing to one of the numbers, mine points to 5 for May -The arrow has one digit to the left of it and another to the right, mine has 1 & 9 for 2019. I, too, called the company; and was given the same reason; the Sun degrades the strength of the plastic due to the UV protectants in it. Don't Ask. I like the width of this chock, and it's sturdy. However May 2019 I'll replace it; with a different material than one that expires.
customer_reviews.author: PAA

customer_reviews.title: Not for outside use
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package I found there's a written warning about sunlight damaging the chocks. Given I wanted them for long term use in my driveway, a non-starter. Returned for refund, would have saved me time and aggravation had the online description mentioned the sunlight issue.
customer_reviews.author: GerardW

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not only is it big and bulky but it doesn't even fit between the tandem trailer wheels on my toy hauler. So I gave it to a friend and he said it didn't fit between his tandem trailer wheels so in my opinion it is completely useless you are better to buy the little individual ones that you talk in front of one tire and the back of the same Tire
customer_reviews.author: MSG

customer_reviews.title: Total crap!!!! DO NOT TRUST your life with these!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible!!!! made of plastic they slide on concrete and will not hold your vehicle in place!!! I was able to push my car and these thing just slide along right in front of the tire. DO NOT TRUST THEM!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected, but do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I assumed these were a bit bigger when I bought them. Now that I've used them to secure our 27' camper all summer, I'm glad they're the size they are. These chocks stop the camper from moving on any relatively level area. Don't get stackable chocks if you might use them on dirt, these are way better and wont sink into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: These work really well, we had a old set of the smaller ones and my camper rolled over them as I was hooking up. If it was not already in the hitch the trailer would of rolled into the woods.Light weight, inexpensive and easy to store
customer_reviews.author: Jim Krywko

customer_reviews.title: Ordered one thinking it was a pair. Still happy after purchasing a second.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 5x8 trailer that is stored on a hill. I purchased 1 of these thinking I would receive a pair. It was my mistake. I ordered a second one after receiving the first one. They are bigger than I expected. Big enough that you can easily give it a solid kick after placing it under the wheel. The rope helps cause it can take a fair amount of force to pull these out. They really lock in under the wheel. I gave the trailer a big shove after placing these and it didn't budge at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chance1117

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions incorrect
customer_reviews.text: This item does not measure 8.4 x 6 x 5.1. The 8.4 is very close to correct, but the actual width is 4 9/16" and height is 4 3/16". I bought this item specifically because of the dimensions, so I am unable to use them. They are very light, so I'm not sure how they would actually serve their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Teetsee

customer_reviews.title: Great value and product!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I guess you get what you pay for because after using a few different times they broke! They were a great price but when they break, it doesn't matter. I was past the return window so I am out of luck. We use a rubber mallet to tap the chicks under the tires. My other chocks have no problem. Very disappointed. These little chocks are a life saver when on the road with your RV. They are super sturdy and I love the rope handle. Makes hanging them up after use, a breeze. I just have to see if they make other camping items! Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good quality, light enough to carry in a 172's baggage compartment.  Too tall for some wheel pants.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, good quality, just the right size for a 600 x 6 aircraft tire, and light enough to chuck in the plane's baggage compartment. Too tall for some wheel pants. Lanyards make handling without getting dirty easy. If only they made a cloth bag with a drawstring top (of same color) to put them in to keep the baggage area tidy....
customer_reviews.author: AudioEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Chocks
customer_reviews.text: I have used these several times now whenever I have a car or truck on a jack to prevent rolling. I was concerned they wouldn't be strong enough because they are plastic. Turns out they are perfectly strong and do the job well. I also like that they are yellow, which makes them easier to see, which in turn makes it easier to remember to remove them when the job is done.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary S Roberts

customer_reviews.title: OKAY
customer_reviews.text: Great price, made in the USA, fits the entire width of the tire too, but slips a lot before it grabs... not very confident in its grip which may improve in time as it gets roughed up some.
customer_reviews.author: Cappy

customer_reviews.title: they held better on dirt
customer_reviews.text: These things are ok but don't seem to have a lot of traction and I frequently will get out of the camper and find that the chocks aren't still aligned with the tires. They are very light weight and I think that contributes to it - I tend to notice them moving around on concrete or rock surfaces, they held better on dirt. I'll probably look at other options in the future and if you're considering these maybe look at something a little heavier duty
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Wrong item packaged from Camco
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 2-pack of wheel chocks with rope. I got a box sealed from Camco saying “Wheel Chock with Rope, Yellow 2-pack”. I open the box and there is no rope (see pictures). I called up Camco and they said that I bought through Amazon so I have to deal with them, even though it was a Camco sealed box. I contact Amazon and the delay for a replacement is 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Cautious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Set of two came as described
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light weight and steep enough I'm not worried about the tire rolling over it. Made in Greensboro, NC and shipped in packaging from Thomasville, NC, that was a pleasant surprise. No unsolicited requests for reviews or comments. Cons: They don't nestle up to my teeny tiny trailer wheels, I didn't expect a perfect fit and I should have thought about the tire size relevancy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: fit well under the tire
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly purchased these thinking they were like the bigger pair I already had. Turns out, I like these. The bad thing is that they are smaller and I'm not sure how much weight they will hold using them on my RV. The good thing is they definitely fit under the tires better and hold better than the larger Camco set I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty much the same wheel chocks you can pick up ...
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty much the same wheel chocks you can pick up at a big box store or camping store. When I purchased these where on Amazon, however, I saved a few dollars. They are made of plastic but support the wheels on our travel trailer and my in-laws RV just fine. I would recommend two sets so you have a set of chocks for each side of your vehicle. Of course, these can also be useful for other vehicle needs (in the shop, or while changing a tire on the side of the road).
customer_reviews.author: M. Hadden

customer_reviews.title: I'm too old to get run over
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of ramps for 40+ years, which were useless with today's lower cars. After watching a youtube video of how to build extensions for my ramps, I'm actually able to get under my cars again, for oil changes, etc. These Camco chocks are a sturdy and inexpensive way for me to avoid getting squished, should my car start to roll.
customer_reviews.author: Audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Junk don't waste your $ Buy American made X Chocks they are worth the $
customer_reviews.author: Jerimiah Reeves

customer_reviews.title: These are perfectly fine. They do what they are supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: These are perfectly fine. They do what they are supposed to do. I use them for my 25ft travel trailer that is about 7000lbs. I also use X-Chocks, which are amazing! I would give this more stars but for some reason that makes no sense to me I was only able to buy one at the "add-on" price. They do know these should be used in at least pairs, right? I had my GF buy one.........we have two.
customer_reviews.author: Ted K.

customer_reviews.title: they work kinda
customer_reviews.text: I used them 4 times. Half of the time they moved out from under the tires.. I guess it depends how abrasive the surface is under your vehicle.. I wouldn't buy these again.. I might give them away and get new ones actually... I suggest purchasing chocks that have rubber bottoms on them.
customer_reviews.author: The Guild of Calamitous Intent

customer_reviews.title: Yabba dabba doo they were great
customer_reviews.text: They were great I have an overland trailer I just wanted something real to chalk the wheels. I bought four of them and they can all stack together. But overall I'm very pleased they're lightweight they're cheap but they're doing a job I have not had any problems with them and I have used them a few times.
customer_reviews.author: B.m

customer_reviews.title: Thinner than Tupperware
customer_reviews.text: GREAT COMPANY, poor product: I love that they stack together and are light weight, however, they have no grip, slide, and crack under weight. I prefer my Harbor Freight wheel chock to this a hundred fold. Camco made it right though, so I ended up purchasing their yellow wheel chocks and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: JP Feast

customer_reviews.title: The weight is best feature. Can't go wrong with these
customer_reviews.text: Just what you should expect from plastic. I also have a set of rubber ones which grip the asphalt better but they are heavy. These Camco are a great compliment to those so I can secure my trailer. We always walk our trailer twice before hooking it up and driving off so they will break if you run them over as we have seen so many times at campgrounds. The bright yellow color is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Camco delivers again. Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: As always Camco delivered a fantastic RV product. Yes you can buy at the big box stores but you do save money on Amazon if you hunt around. These were ordered about a week before our journey from Alaska to Portland Oregon, and arrived within 3-4 days. We only used while at 5 different RV parks in our travels, to be fair, 2 spots were completely flat with no worries of movement. We did chock the tires anyway. We only chocked the tires that were not on the leveling platforms but we had no issues aside from forgetting to unchock. But the chicks endured and other than a few scratches will be used again this summer.
customer_reviews.author: saharasnow

customer_reviews.title: They slide easily. Not reliable in my book
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know wheel chocks had an expiration date but these are labeled that they should be replaced in 2006. Totally Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Royal Showing

customer_reviews.title: Good wheel chocks, tho a bit small
customer_reviews.text: These chocks are great in combination with other wheel devices b/c they are rather small for the size wheels on our trailer (15"). If I had to do it again, I would order heavier duty chocks, tho these work if there isn't a good-sized slope on the trailer site. Nice, light-weight, and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: LTD

customer_reviews.title: Holds the trailer still
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to keep my trailer from rolling away when it is parked. They do that very well. I do wish that they had some kind of attachment point for a rope to keep them attached to each other. I had to drill holes in them in order to attach my own.
customer_reviews.author: iPoutside365

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the rope?!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically wanted the ropes to make it easier to pull the chocks out. Not worth the time and hassle to contact amazon so I’ll have to go out and buy some rope. Of course it will be more than I need. Apart from that, the product is fine.
customer_reviews.author: SandykayakTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight and do that job. You get a pair, so, for those that are unfamiliar with wheel chocks - Make sure you put one in FRONT of the tire, and, one BEHIND the same tire. That prevents forward and backward movement. I have two sets, in case, there is enough incline to make the trailer still want to move with one wheel chocked.
customer_reviews.author: Bykergus

customer_reviews.title: Superhero strong
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how easy it is to use something as powerful as these wheel chocks. These godly yellow ramps will secure anything that is round and tired of you yelling at it all day firmly in place and glued to the earth beneath its axle like a mighty redwood.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Brittle
customer_reviews.text: May stop a camper from rolling on its own... at least on flat land. I broke one the first weekend. Forgot to get one out from under the wheel. Pulled right over it and shattered, and never even noticed till I got back home. Didn't feel it under the wheel at all.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy (Shammy)

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what else to say about this somewhat industrial item. It keeps my horse trailer from rolling anywhere and is an essential thing to have if you park a trailer and don't want to see it barreling down the very slight hill you parked on.
customer_reviews.author: deborah

customer_reviews.title: Good for small trailers
customer_reviews.text: Served their purpose. Smaller than expected. I use it for a trailer on a fairly level surface. I would feel comfortable with big times or Steeper surface. Serves its purpose for the price just expected them to be more rugged
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gosselin

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: It is a piece of plastic that helps prevent a vehicle from rolling. Does what it should, lightweight and easy to move. The only thing I am not crazy about it the rope is in the middle of the chock, but should be on the taller end of it. I just drilled a new hole and ran it through that one and it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nalon1

customer_reviews.title: Nice wheel chocks.  My favorite kind.
customer_reviews.text: I now own three pairs of these. I find them easier to use when compared to the rubber chocks for light and medium duty vehicles. My first set is almost 15 yrs old so they definitely last. Will purchase again when I need another set.
customer_reviews.author: TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: out of the box i was thinking small and dinky but needed something and here it was. on a slope, I put 2 behind a fully loaded 2 ton food trailer hooked to a chevrolet 2500 and bump, dead stop. Could probably jump them in full reverse mode but surprisingly for their construction and size, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Stefany L. Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Since they don't usually have much pressure on them I didn't feel like I needed to spend more for the same models ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the back side of my RV wheels, (the side without pressure) just to prevent the rv from rolling backwards. Since they don't usually have much pressure on them I didn't feel like I needed to spend more for the same models with the rope tied to them. I now have about 6 of these, since my motorhome has dual wheels and I don't want it rolling off the leveling jacks. They are lightweight but built pretty tough and do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: OBG

customer_reviews.title: They work o.k. but...
customer_reviews.text: These function exactly as they say and are a great price and very light to carry in your rig. They have two problems in my opinion. 1) They are very small. One picture shows them against an actual tire to give you a size comparison. Look at this carefully. 2) They don't really stay in place that well on pavement. My recommendation is if you are looking for chocks, buy the big heavy duty rubber ones. I had those in my last trailer and really liked them. But they went with that trailer when it sold so I will be getting another set. I will find a lighter duty use for these around the garage though.
customer_reviews.author: RH in Az.

customer_reviews.title: They'll work but........
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my lawn tractor and for that they'll work fine but frankly had I known they had an expiration date I would have purchased the heavier rubber chocks instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need for my little guy camper.
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight Wheel Chock is perfect for small campers. I've used chunks of wood in the past, because I don't like to add weight to my car's load. Though it's lightweight, the grooves are more secure than wood. Seller shipped it fast, too.
customer_reviews.author: Melek

customer_reviews.title: I joked with him afterwards that he was just testing them because of the crazy places we like to go
customer_reviews.text: We ended up having to buy a second set of these after my boyfriend drove over the first ones. He thought it was a rock, so he made his truck get over it. It broke, but not nearly as badly as I was expecting. He also really had to work to get over it. I joked with him afterwards that he was just testing them because of the crazy places we like to go. We know now our trailer isn't going to budge!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea J.

customer_reviews.title: wheel chocks
customer_reviews.text: these work good, but they do NOT have the rubber pad on the bottom to keep them from slipping, that's why I only gave it 4 stars...that little extra step would make these a lot safer and couldn't possibly add that much to the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Anne M. Otterstrom

customer_reviews.title: these are not sturdy enough to rely on safely for anything heavy
customer_reviews.text: These are as described, but for me, too small to be of much use. After I backed over them and squashed them a couple of times, I realized that I really need the larger ones. In my opinion, these are not sturdy enough to rely on safely for anything heavy, like a car or travel trailer.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done for a great price
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about wheel chocks? Well they are inexpensive they are sturdy and they do the job they are designed for. So I would say go for them you can't go wrong. This is my second set and they just work
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Camco Wheel Chocks work
customer_reviews.text: I like that this pair of chocks are bright yellow instead of the usual black. The chocks are sturdy but lightweight with raised grippers for holding the tire, and on the bottom to prevent sliding. I highly recommend these Camco wheel chocks.
customer_reviews.author: Harley H.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I was using various sizes of left over wood pieces. This set of chocks is much better. My wife thinks so as well. Glad I bought it and would buy again. I use it to chock my boat trailer.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: HOLDS VEHICLE SECURE
customer_reviews.text: I am not a young guy now and this device adds a level of mental comfort I now prefer when working beneath my vehicle. I do not want to be concerned about possible movement while in a tight position. This wheel chock works well and I would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: wyman2004

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy, cheap plastic wheel chocks. They work fine. I have several sets. I use them for vehicles with no brakes and trailers. They last a long time. I'm sure I will buy another set sooner or later.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these on amazon.com and I love them. They are perfect for keeping your camper or tailor in place while you hitch up. I have them under my car on a slope because we had a damaged wheel. It had kept the car from rolling for over a week. For the price, you can’t beat the quality. I have a 34′ camper and this is why I purchase them. I would purchase again and again for any project of mine. They don’t slide!
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great wheel chocks. The listing was terribly MISLEADING! It stated "2-pack". However, after going back and looking at the listing again, there was one option to buy a 2-pack....the other options were for ONE item. The item I bought was a pair of chocks, and I naively expected four!
customer_reviews.author: Steamer

customer_reviews.title: Fair enough
customer_reviews.text: These are priced right. They're not amazing, nor are they all that sturdy, but they do the job fine, and they don't cost much, so if that's what you're looking for, go ahead and buy a set of these.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: These are great and good price!
customer_reviews.text: Work well and have used on our box, utility and boat trailers. Cheap and have worked well to keep trailers in place. Glad we got them, gives confidence when parking and leaving.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: these are perfect for my camper. they are larger than I thought which is a good thing I highly recommend this product. the price is excellent you can't go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Cain

customer_reviews.title: WOW these are NICE!
customer_reviews.text: We have a small Casita camper. I wanted something heavy and durable for home use, keeping my lightweight set ready for travel. These are wonderful, very solid and there is an easy to grip handle built into the shape. Would probably also work for much heavier vehicles than mine. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: keep it simple

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Two camping seasons in and these things are still looking like new. They are light weight, yet sturdy. I use them at the campsite and when my pop-up is stored in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Hollow Plastic, Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This chock popped/snapped due to the slightest rock-back when unhitching my travel trailer. Not only does it not serve its intended purpose, but it's flat-out dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B

customer_reviews.title: Needed wheel chocks for my boat trailer
customer_reviews.text: Good price and easy to use. I move my boat trailer around a lot and have used rocks and logs to keep it from rolling. These do the job and being lightweight make it even better.
customer_reviews.author: North Fork Larry

customer_reviews.title: they work
customer_reviews.text: It's a wheel chock there are only two ways to go wrong with these put them next to the tire backwards or not put them wedge them in at all, if you can't use these correctly you should not be operating anything harder than a rake.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Good Chocks
customer_reviews.text: These wheel chocks work great and are lightweight. Definitely recommend them. Just make sure you remember to remove them before moving camper, as others have shown me how they will not last when driven over. That is not product fault.
customer_reviews.author: Jody D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright color,
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for the job they were designed to do. The bright color is easy to see. They fit in the small box in the front of our dump trailer. I would recommend you get these and secure your stationary load properly.
customer_reviews.author: S in California

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but you get what you pay for .
customer_reviews.text: They’re small but you get what you pay for .
customer_reviews.author: Rita McLain

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a while
customer_reviews.text: They are inexpensive. One time I forgot to remove it from the wheel and ran it over. Got busted, so, very inexpensive. I would not buy again for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Abidehandy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy and tough. They will crush if you forget and don't remove them with out damaging the tire. They spring back to near new shape and are still useable.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Man

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: Expectations (met): keep my 2010 Fusion Sport from rolling Summary There really isn't much to be said when it comes to a set of wheel chocks. I feel that these are safer than the two pieces of wood I was using before. And the $9.95 I paid for the pair is definitely worth the peace of mind. I'll update the review in the future if anything changes but so far these chocks do exactly what they're supposed to and I can't ask for anything more.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a big camper.
customer_reviews.text: I have a big tandem axle 34' camper. They fit the width of the entire tire and don't weigh too much. You can put a rope through it too.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A Schriefer

customer_reviews.title: Need both for one wheel
customer_reviews.text: The product does what is needed; however, you will need to use both for one wheel in order to keep it in place. This comes in a set of 2, so i would recommend buying two sets in order to secure the trailer in place.
customer_reviews.author: Minh

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy, lightweight, prone to slipping
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly flimsy and prone to slipping. Maybe good for like a riding lawn mower? Definitely not adequate for anything of any heft or importance.
customer_reviews.author: EricD

customer_reviews.title: Work great and easy to store when not in use
customer_reviews.text: Although these are smaller than what I wanted they do function well and are don't take much room to store. In fact, I have several of this size and keep them in the tool box of my pickup. The bigger ones take up much more storage space when not in use. That's something to think about when considering your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paved With Gold

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to help keep my trailer in place (single axle). Well constructed. They feature a ribbed surface on the tire side AND on the ground side. Large enough to work well in normal conditions yet small & lite enough to store easily. Highly visable to allow me to see them in place (to remove) before towing the trailer. They have a thru hole to allow a rope to be placed thru it to connect multiple together or to act as a way to carry/remove it (no, rope is not included)
customer_reviews.author: WRP

customer_reviews.title: super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I added a two foot rope to each of mine so that they are easier to retrieve when i get ready to leave a site. The hold the rig in place and after a year, show no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: GREG PERRY

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed light weight plastic wheel chocks for my horse carriages and these work nicely. I also like that there is a rope hole on the chock. I added a rope for a handle so I can place the chock behind the wheel, harness, step in and then pull up on the rope to remove it while sitting in the carriage. Great light weight wheel Chock!
customer_reviews.author: Tucalota

customer_reviews.title: They do the job intended.
customer_reviews.text: These are wheel chocks, so not much to say about them. They are sturdy and lightweight. We bought two sets for our travel trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Freeman

customer_reviews.title: These are smaller than i anticipated them to be, which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: These fit nicely in my truck toolbox when not in use. They're smaller/narrower than I imagined they would be. Happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sutcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic, which means they're really light weight. They do feel pretty tough, and they grip OK. The design is generally good, but a heavier material would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for camper
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and good quality. You need a set for both sides of camper. You should place in front and back of tires. Been using for 5 years and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Made here at home :)
customer_reviews.text: These look like good chocks, seem sturdy enough, but time will tell. They are Made in the USA, which is very important to us.
customer_reviews.author: DeeJayBee

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and function as intended. Over the course ...
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and function as intended. Over the course of two years or so they will become brittle an need replacing; acceptable in my case as they are in contact with hot temperatures of the California high desert.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Berberena

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Used these the first time and was pleased with them. These are smaller than I thought but they worked fine for me. I have a smaller camper.
customer_reviews.author: Babette Hiles

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Chocks
customer_reviews.text: Always use these when changing oil with the E-Brake. I dont think these have ever come into use besides the backup to the E-Brake but they do that better.
customer_reviews.author: JBurr

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go in a trailer tool box to have while trailering my boat. A quick test and they seemed to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: Camco wheel chocks
customer_reviews.text: We use these all the time, it sure beat carrying a cinder block over ever time we needed to chock tires. I do use more reinforcement when I am working on our trucks. I can say these have worked on a 1/2 Ton truck and a 1/2 ton suburban, lawn mowers, to keep wood from moving, we use them for everything. If they were a bit bigger that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Chief WhiteCloud

customer_reviews.title: Great price, works great on my tow dolly
customer_reviews.text: No more runaway tow dolly! This works great and at the best price. Be sure you have the right side facing the tires, 2 sides are different, curve side goes against the tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon.Fan

customer_reviews.title: Use as Designed
customer_reviews.text: I use these to chock the rear wheels on my lawn tractor when I am working on the mower deck. It's a measure of security that you should not be without when inclining a utility vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: 1stRaymond

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic, do not stay under tire
customer_reviews.text: would not recommend anyone to buy these, the tire just pushes them across driveway. mite work better in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Carter

customer_reviews.title: how much wheel would a wheel chock if a wheel chock could chock a wheel?
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my utility trailer. Its a wheel chock, not many other special features, feels solid and seems like it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Greener

customer_reviews.title: Cheep and cheep
customer_reviews.text: I would spend the extra and get solid rubber stops instead. This are cheesy to use and don’t work like I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: HNL

customer_reviews.title: They will work, but no ropes.
customer_reviews.text: They will hold the trailer, but they don't have ropes. I didn't buy them for the ropes, but expected them to be on there.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Overall like them, but they're almost too light
customer_reviews.text: Overall like them, but they're almost too light. If they weren't wedged in to the wheel a decent wind blows them around. These are great where light-weight chocks are needed, like a travel trailer or the like. If it's just to store a trailer at home (such as my case for a utility trailer), IMHO heavier rubber ones would be better so they stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Light and wimpy
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight is the on plus to these. They don’t fit tight into my tandem wheels and end up blowing away when windy out. Not sturdy
customer_reviews.author: RANGER 34

customer_reviews.title: Good product, priced well is made with quality and durability in mind.
customer_reviews.text: Well made ABS plastic chocks work perfectly for my smaller passenger car. This product was priced well and just plain works. Pull ropes could be a little better quality, however that's not a showstopper and otherwise this product just gives you peace of mind that your car won't roll, while up on stands.
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: BIG chocks, that fit my Class A Motorhome.
customer_reviews.text: These chocks may not technically support a 13K rv, but for now, it's what I'm using. I didn't want to spend over $100 for something that may not even (necessarily) need to be used, as I'm on pretty flat ground.
customer_reviews.author: Newporter 949

customer_reviews.title: Wheel chocks that work well
customer_reviews.text: Wheel chocks that work well. Yes they are plastic, but quite sturdy. I have a micro-lite trailer from Malone that I use for hauling two kayaks and I keep the trailer in my Garage, which is on a slight slope. I slap these behind the wheels of the trailer to secure it in place and it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: John DW

customer_reviews.title: I would feel comfortable using them for our car
customer_reviews.text: These chocks work, but are not very big. I would feel comfortable using them for our car, but had purchased with the intention of using them on new RV and our pickup truck and am not sure they are quite sturdy enough for the larger vehicles. Having the rope to help remove them is a very nice design feature.
customer_reviews.author: DulceDragon

customer_reviews.title: Light and work great
customer_reviews.text: I have a utility trailer with 15" wheels and these chocks work great. They are very light weight and large enough to fit the tires perfectly. I have two sets one set for each wheel to keep the trailer from moving when I park it and load and unload during camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: nobody

product_meta.title: Camco 44472 Wheel Chock With Rope For Easy Removal, Helps Keep Your Trailer or RV In Place (Pack of 1), Yellow
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pack| Style:Wheel Chock With RopeCamco's 44472 RV Wheel Chock with Rope is designed to keep your trailer in place so that you can re-hitch with confidence. It is constructed of durable hard plastic with UV inhibitors giving you years of use. The included rope makes removing the chock from the wheel safe and easy. Designed to be used on tires up to 26”.
feature_bullets: Keeps trailer in place so you can re-hitch with confidence
Constructed of durable hard plastic with UV inhibitors for years of use
Includes rope for safe and easy removal from the wheel
For use with tires up to 26" in diameter
Not for commercial use or with heavy commercial type trucks or trailers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,282 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
